Class Button

A convenience directive for applying styling to a button.

See demo

Example:

<button ibmButton>A button</button>
<button ibmButton="secondary">A secondary button</button>

See the vanilla carbon docs for more detail.

../../iframe.html?id=button--basic

Properties

assistiveTextAlignment

@Input()
assistiveTextAlignment: "center" | "start" | "end" = "center"
  • Defined in src/button/button.directive.ts:48

If assistive text is used, this specifies the alignment. Possible alignments are center, start, end. If assistive text is not used, this can be left undefined.

assistiveTextPlacement

@Input()
assistiveTextPlacement: "top" | "bottom" | "left" | "right" = "top"
  • Defined in src/button/button.directive.ts:42

If assistive text is used, this specifies the placement. Possible placements are top, bottom, left, right. If assistive text is not used, this can be left undefined.

hasAssistiveText

@HostBinding({"hostPropertyName":"class.bx--tooltip__trigger"})
@HostBinding({"hostPropertyName":"class.bx--tooltip--a11y"})
@Input()
hasAssistiveText: boolean = false
  • Defined in src/button/button.directive.ts:96

hasAssistiveText input specifies whether the button contains assistive text or not. Assistive text can be utilized as follows:

    <button
        ibmButton="tertiary"
        [iconOnly]="true"
        [hasAssistiveText]="true"
        assistiveTextPlacement="top"
        assistiveTextAlignment="center">
        <svg class="bx--btn__icon" ibmIconCopy size="20"></svg>
        <span class="bx--assistive-text">Icon description</span>
    </button>

ibmButton: ButtonType = "primary"
  • Defined in src/button/button.directive.ts:32

sets the button type
